alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:35AM CST until January 26 at 4:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Sweeny. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water begins spilling into the left floodplain. Water is over the mid level walkway at the Phillips Terminal near Sweeny. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Wednesday was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 12/09/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat San Bernard River Sweeny 7.0 9.8 Wed 8 am CST 7.3 6.1 4.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CST.
